<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SHIPPING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/28/ever-given-still-stuck-suez-canal-salvagers-eye-progress?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It Moved
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/28/ever-given-still-stuck-suez-canal-salvagers-eye-progress" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Ship stuck in Suez Canal" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTI1L3NoaXBfc3R1Y2tfaW5fc3Vlel9jYW5hbC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mahmoud Khaled/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The most interesting thing to happen to all of our lives since Bernie Sanders tried to keep himself warm at the presidential inauguration could be close to resolution. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Ever Given, a mind-bogglingly huge container ship that’s been blocking the Suez Canal for almost a week, holding up an estimated $9.6 billion in goods a day, is way less stuck than it used to be. As of 4am ET this morning, workers were able to partially refloat the ship, and the stern (the back of the boat) was 300 feet clear of the shore. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Word of the weekend: dredging</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The process of re-floating a container ship 4x heavier than the Sydney Harbour Bridge is just as complex as you’d imagine, and requires lots of dredging—the process of removing sediment from water bodies to keep them navigable. Over the weekend, dredgers at the Suez Canal <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-egypt-suezcanal-ship/tugs-dredgers-still-struggle-to-free-ship-blocking-suez-canal-idUSKBN2BK08V?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dug 18 meters down</a> and shifted 27,000 cubic meters of sand in the hopes of getting the Ever Given floating again. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the real hero of this tale? The moon. Rising waters due to high tide made all the dredging work pay off, allowing tugboats to more easily pull the Ever Given from its beached position overnight.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Clearing the passage can’t happen fast enough</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At least 367 ships are stuck in traffic at the canal, carrying precious cargo including oil, liquefied natural gas, sneakers, toys, livestock, toilet paper, cars, and TVs. Around <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/27/world/middleeast/suez-canal-ship-stuck.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">90% of global retail trade</a> is carried on container ships, and the Suez Canal, which provides a shortcut between Asia and Europe, is critical for the flow of goods around the world.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But that hasn’t stopped everyone from having a little fun at the ship’s expense—okay, a <em>lot </em>of fun. You can watch <a href="https://twitter.com/JonHansenTV/status/1375538035551522821?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1375538035551522821%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2021%2F03%2F27%2Fworld%2Fsuez-canal-stuck-ship-memes.html&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">traffic reports</a>. You can <a href="https://evergiven-everywhere.glitch.me/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">move it</a> anywhere in the world. You can <a href="https://twitter.com/chazhutton/status/1374688225516748801?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">get deep</a> about it. You can make <a href="https://twitter.com/Neal_Freyman/status/1375961109975416835?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Passover jokes</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> If the Ever Given can fully break free today and allow traffic to pass, the shipping industry can avoid the worst scarring, according to the NYT. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/28/wall-street-mystery-swirls-massive-block-trades?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Wall Street Whodunit
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In Saturday’s Brew, we noted that shares in Discovery and ViacomCBS had plunged on Friday following analyst downgrades. By the end of the trading day, ViacomCBS had lost half of its value in a week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Turns out there’s a <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-goldman-sachs-stocks/large-block-trades-that-caused-selling-raises-questions-about-cause-idUSKBN2BJ0KO?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lot more</a> intrigue to this story.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The stocks of those two companies and several US-listed Chinese tech firms, including Tencent Music and Baidu, were involved in massive “block trades” together worth almost $19 billion.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A block trade is when huge amounts of shares trade hands, typically through negotiation outside of the open market to keep stock prices stable. They’re not uncommon among big investors on Wall Street, but Friday’s action was “</span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-27/-unprecedented-wall-street-ponders-goldman-s-block-trade-spree?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unprecedented</a></span><span>,” a portfolio manager told Bloomberg.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2021, you don’t just toss out the “U” word unless something really fishy is going on, which is why many analysts speculated that the trades indicated an investment shop was in trouble and needed to liquidate.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That turned out to be correct: CNBC <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/27/archegos-capital-forced-position-liquidation-contributes-to-viacom-discovery-plunge.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> that the selling pressure was tied to positions of Archegos Capital Management, the multibillion-dollar family office of Bill Hwang, a former trader at hedge fund Tiger Management. Basically, what allegedly happened is that Archegos's lenders forced it to sell more than $20 billion worth of shares on Friday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking</strong> <strong style="color:#000">ahead...</strong>banks Nomura and Credit Suisse have warned of potentially "significant" losses due to transactions with an unspecified client (wonder who that could be). This morning, “Global traders are bracing for what’s shaping up to be one of the <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-28/traders-are-glued-to-their-screens-and-set-for-volatile-open?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most anticipated opens</a> for US equities in months,” writes Bloomberg.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MUSIC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/28/spain-holds-rock-concert-5000-people-covid-test?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
For Those Who Just Rocked, We Salute You
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/28/spain-holds-rock-concert-5000-people-covid-test" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Spanish concert" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTIzL3NwYW5pc2hfY29uY2VydC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Xavi Torrent/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wanna escape Spain’s restrictions limiting most gatherings to four people? Go to a rock concert. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Saturday night, the Spanish band Love of Lesbian <a href="https://apnews.com/article/entertainment-health-coronavirus-pandemic-barcelona-music-75d9bc234b0a15735871a7cf0d28b25b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">performed</a> for 5,000 people at Barcelona’s Palau Sant Jordi concert hall.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The concert was a <a href="https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2021/3/28/thousands-attend-barcelona-rock-concert-after-covid-tests?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">government-sanctioned test</a> to determine whether events in controlled settings could restart again without contributing to the spread of the coronavirus. Concert-goers took a rapid Covid test earlier in the day, and the result showed up on their phones 10–15 minutes later. High-quality masks were required but social distancing and accurately knowing song lyrics were not. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It was pretty emotional for the performers, whose industry has been first-to-close, last-to-open during the pandemic. “It’s been a year and half since we last set foot on a stage as a band...some of the musicians are crying over here,” said lead singer Santi Balmes.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Organizers said it was the biggest commercial event held in Europe since the pandemic began. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY HINT WATER
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Staying Hydrated Shouldn’t Be a Chore
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<a href="https://www.drinkhint.com/collections/36brew?utm_medium=partnerships&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=evergreen-byob36-year2021&utm_type=pr&utm_test=control" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Hint Water" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMjIxMS8xNjE2NzAyMDg5LTAyNTVfUGludGVyZXN0X1BpbnNfMTUwMHgxNTAwLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Water. Sometimes it feels like you can’t live with it, and ya can’t live without it. Ok, maybe you just can’t live without it, but getting in those eight glasses a day can be a drag.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s cuz water is lacking the pizzazz, excitement, and intrigue of a drink with, you know, flavor.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.drinkhint.com/collections/36brew?utm_medium=partnerships&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=evergreen-byob36-year2021&utm_type=pr&utm_test=control" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Hint</a>, however? It’s a superbly tasty H20 that delivers true fruit flavor <strong style="color:#000">without sugar, sweeteners, or calories</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With refreshing flavors like <strong style="color:#000">Watermelon, Blackberry, and Pineapple,</strong> you can quench your thirst, toast to your health, and make an obnoxious “<em>AHHH</em>” each time you go to hydrate.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>A national index tracking demand for office space <a href="https://www.globest.com/2021/03/25/suddenly-demand-is-booming-for-office-space/?kw=Suddenly,%20Demand%20is%20Booming%20for%20Office%20Space&utm_source=email&utm_medium=enl&utm_campaign=nationalamalert&utm_content=20210325&utm_term=rem&enlcmp=nltrplt4&slreturn=20210228101613&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gained 29%</a> last month, led by growth in Seattle, New York City, and Washington, DC. Overall demand is now at 38% below pre-pandemic levels.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>"I look at it this way. The first time we have an excuse. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dr. Deborah Birx, the former White House coronavirus response coordinator under President Trump, <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/03/27/politics/covid-war-deaths-preventable/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">opened up</a> about the administration's failures to contain Covid-19 in a CNN documentary that aired last night.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>An excellent discussion on genomic sequencing. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">All eyes on Minneapolis: </strong>The <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2021/03/28/derek-chauvin-trial-minneapolis-prepares-george-floyd-case/7018505002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">trial</a> for Derek Chauvin, the former Minneapolis police officer charged with the murder of George Floyd, begins today.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Jobs report: </strong>The Labor Department will drop employment numbers for March this Friday. Economists project 565,000 jobs were added to the economy, continuing an upward trend.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Infrastructure: </strong>Is Infrastructure Week finally here? <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Sports: </strong>The men’s and women’s college basketball tournaments roll on this week, and MLB’s Opening Day is Thursday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Curtains: </strong>On Wednesday, <em>Godzilla vs. Kong </em>is hitting HBO Max and theaters simultaneously after a <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/godzilla-vs-kong-stomps-to-pandemic-best-122m-foreign-start?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dominant start</a> internationally. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else:</strong></p>

<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The US stock market will be closed for Good Friday.</span></li>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe most interesting thing to happen to all of our lives since Bernie Sanders tried to keep himself warm at the presidential inauguration could be close to resolution. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Ever Given, a mind-bogglingly huge container ship that’s been blocking the Suez Canal for almost a week, holding up an estimated $9.6 billion in goods a day, is way less stuck than it used to be. As of 4am ET this morning, workers were able to partially refloat the ship, and the stern (the back of the boat) was 300 feet clear of the shore. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWord of the weekend: dredging\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe process of re-floating a container ship 4x heavier than the Sydney Harbour Bridge is just as complex as you’d imagine, and requires lots of dredging—the process of removing sediment from water bodies to keep them navigable. Over the weekend, dredgers at the Suez Canal \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-egypt-suezcanal-ship/tugs-dredgers-still-struggle-to-free-ship-blocking-suez-canal-idUSKBN2BK08V?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edug 18 meters down\u003c/a\u003e and shifted 27,000 cubic meters of sand in the hopes of getting the Ever Given floating again. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut the real hero of this tale? The moon. Rising waters due to high tide made all the dredging work pay off, allowing tugboats to more easily pull the Ever Given from its beached position overnight.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eClearing the passage can’t happen fast enough\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt least 367 ships are stuck in traffic at the canal, carrying precious cargo including oil, liquefied natural gas, sneakers, toys, livestock, toilet paper, cars, and TVs. Around \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/27/world/middleeast/suez-canal-ship-stuck.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e90% of global retail trade\u003c/a\u003e is carried on container ships, and the Suez Canal, which provides a shortcut between Asia and Europe, is critical for the flow of goods around the world.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut that hasn’t stopped everyone from having a little fun at the ship’s expense—okay, a \u003cem\u003elot \u003c/em\u003eof fun. You can watch \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/JonHansenTV/status/1375538035551522821?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1375538035551522821%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_\u0026ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2021%2F03%2F27%2Fworld%2Fsuez-canal-stuck-ship-memes.html\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etraffic reports\u003c/a\u003e. You can \u003ca href=\"https://evergiven-everywhere.glitch.me/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emove it\u003c/a\u003e anywhere in the world. You can \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/chazhutton/status/1374688225516748801?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eget deep\u003c/a\u003e about it. You can make \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/Neal_Freyman/status/1375961109975416835?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ePassover jokes\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e If the Ever Given can fully break free today and allow traffic to pass, the shipping industry can avoid the worst scarring, according to the style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn Saturday’s Brew, we noted that shares in Discovery and ViacomCBS had plunged on Friday following analyst downgrades. By the end of the trading day, ViacomCBS had lost half of its value in a week.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTurns out there’s a \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-goldman-sachs-stocks/large-block-trades-that-caused-selling-raises-questions-about-cause-idUSKBN2BJ0KO?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elot more\u003c/a\u003e intrigue to this story.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe stocks of those two companies and several US-listed Chinese tech firms, including Tencent Music and Baidu, were involved in massive “block trades” together worth almost $19 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA block trade is when huge amounts of shares trade hands, typically through negotiation outside of the open market to keep stock prices stable. They’re not uncommon among big investors on Wall Street, but Friday’s action was “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-27/-unprecedented-wall-street-ponders-goldman-s-block-trade-spree?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunprecedented\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e,” a portfolio manager told Bloomberg.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2021, you don’t just toss out the “U” word unless something really fishy is going on, which is why many analysts speculated that the trades indicated an investment shop was in trouble and needed to liquidate.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat turned out to be correct: CNBC \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/27/archegos-capital-forced-position-liquidation-contributes-to-viacom-discovery-plunge.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e that the selling pressure was tied to positions of Archegos Capital Management, the multibillion-dollar family office of Bill Hwang, a former trader at hedge fund Tiger Management. Basically, what allegedly happened is that Archegos's lenders forced it to sell more than $20 billion worth of shares on Friday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eahead...\u003c/strong\u003ebanks Nomura and Credit Suisse have warned of potentially \"significant\" losses due to transactions with an unspecified client (wonder who that could be). This morning, “Global traders are bracing for what’s shaping up to be one of the \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-28/traders-are-glued-to-their-screens-and-set-for-volatile-open?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost anticipated opens\u003c/a\u003e for US equities in months,” writes collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWanna escape Spain’s restrictions limiting most gatherings to four people? Go to a rock concert. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Saturday night, the Spanish band Love of Lesbian \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/entertainment-health-coronavirus-pandemic-barcelona-music-75d9bc234b0a15735871a7cf0d28b25b?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eperformed\u003c/a\u003e for 5,000 people at Barcelona’s Palau Sant Jordi concert hall.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe concert was a \u003ca href=\"https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2021/3/28/thousands-attend-barcelona-rock-concert-after-covid-tests?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egovernment-sanctioned test\u003c/a\u003e to determine whether events in controlled settings could restart again without contributing to the spread of the coronavirus. Concert-goers took a rapid Covid test earlier in the day, and the result showed up on their phones 10–15 minutes later. High-quality masks were required but social distancing and accurately knowing song lyrics were not. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt was pretty emotional for the performers, whose industry has been first-to-close, last-to-open during the pandemic. “It’s been a year and half since we last set foot on a stage as a band...some of the musicians are crying over here,” said lead singer Santi Balmes.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eOrganizers said it was the biggest commercial event held in Europe since the pandemic began. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\"
